mdRecord.dcterms:title: Ljubljanica Sluice Gate, general view
Partition
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Plečnik, Jože (Slovene architect, 1872-1957) [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Ljubljanica Sluice Gate (Slovene: Zapornica na Ljubljanici) or the Partition (Pregrada) is a sluice gate and a triumphal arch on the Ljubljanica River in Ljubljana, the capital of Slovenia. It is located between Cukrarna (an abandoned sugar factory) and Vraz Square (Vrazov trg) in the Center District, to the east of the Ljubljana old town, a bit downstream of the Ambrose Square (Ambrožev trg). -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ljubljanica_Sluice_Gate [work]
